intro: Diuris pedunculata, commonly known as the pink and white spider-orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to southeastern Australia. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is characterized by its striking, spider-like floral structure. The plant features a slender, erect stem with a single or few flowers that are often pink or white in color. Diuris pedunculata blooms in late winter to early spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat. It is a protected species in some regions due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
